etymology.description: 鳳(鳳) (fèng, "phoenix") + 梨(梨) (lí, "pear") + 酥(酥) (sū, "crisp")
etymology.interpretation: 鳳梨(鳳梨) (fènglí, "pineapple") refers to the fruit itself, using a metaphorical reference to a phoenix to denote exoticness and nobility. 酥(酥) (sū, "crisp") describes the texture of the pastry, which is flaky and delicate, giving the overall meaning of a sweet, crisp pastry made with pineapple.

examples.chinese: 我昨天买了凤梨酥(我昨天買了鳳梨酥)。
examples.english: I bought a pineapple cake yesterday.

examples.chinese: 周末时(週末時)，我跟朋友一起品尝凤梨酥(我跟朋友一起品嚐鳳梨酥)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōumò shí, wǒ gēn péngyǒu yīqǐ pǐncháng fènglísū.
examples.english: On the weekend, I tasted pineapple cake with a friend.

examples.chinese: 这种凤梨酥(這種鳳梨酥)，外皮松脆(外皮鬆脆)。
examples.english: This type of pineapple cake has a crispy crust.
